{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3546860,"name":"Tharun","username":"thaMan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/e5b9ba/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-04T02:17:09.900Z","cooked":"

Heys guys we have a quick question that I hope some of you guys can help explaining. Today we were running our bot with the limelight on and noticed that the fuse was tripped in the port we had connected the limelight too. After swapping said fuse from a Red fuse to a blue fuse this fuse immediately tripped and now every port on the pdh (Even the ones with circuit breakers in) are all blinking red. Right now we are thinking that its something to do with the CSA chip but we’re not sure and were wondering if any of you guys could shed some light on the issue.

Another data point from personal experience, we blew a fuse last year and caused our CSA chip to fail, but it only caused problems on the low current channels, not the high current ones. Perhaps contact support@revrobotics.com?

Thanks for the info! We will write shortly to them but might I ask how you guys blew your fuse? I’m wracking my brain trying to think how the CSA chip for even one could’ve broken let alone all of them and I think this would be a good place to start from.

Our power wires for our VRM came out in the VRM end, and then the two wires shorted with each other and blue the fuse :/.

We had an issue when we were using the rev radio power module to power the radio. We were powering the limelight with poe from the radio and everything was fine until we hook up a second limelight through poe and rev power module over heated and shorted out causing it to blow the fuse on the pdh. The fix is to power the radio directly from the pdh without using the rev power module. Also do not power the radio with both direct power and poe as this will damage the radio. If you want to use poe from the radio aux ports there is some switches on the back that will enable poe.

4639 The Robospartans - Build Blog 2025 FRC Open Alliance
FRC 4639 Days 50 and 51, 5 days until Tomball!!! First comp is coming around soon! We got the great opportunity to test our robot out with other robots before this comp thanks to Team 5414, and that really helped us prepare much better for Tomball, so we’re so grateful for that opportunity! Here’s what we got done these past two days. Funnel The funnel finally works! We added a roof to our funnel which seemed to fix all our issues with it getting stuck before reaching the coral mech, so we’re g…

Could this be the cause of your issue? Do a resistance check from the positive and negative power terminals of your LimeLight to the frame and from the positive to the negative terminals.

Hope to be able to meet you and your team in Houston in April.
